After a grueling nine minute thrill packed flight the crew splashed down in Sandusky bay adjacent to the greatest amusement park to grace Lake Erie, Cedar Point. Cedar Point was on the ready for their arrival with 27 genuine  Iroquois birch bark canoes and a flotilla of aluminum car top fishing boats. The crowds numbering the dozens lined the shore with their Polaroid instamatics at the ready. To officiate the gala event Mayor Frank G. Jackson of Cleveland in his new Chartreuse over red limousine was  signing photographs of Elon Musk. A fine time was had by all.

This might be a good time to say something about the one space anomaly that I have actually seen first hand. Maybe if someone saves this and remembers it years from now it might help science a bit. 

Back in 1993 I was on my way home from work driving up Interstate 5 in California from LA County back to Bakersfield in Kern County in the early morning hours. As I climbed the Grapevine in my pickup I'm naturally looking up due to the climb up the mountain. Now here's an example of the best way I can describe what I saw and it lasted for over a minute. 

Take a photo of a blue sky with very little to no cloud cover. Carefully rip a hole in the center of the picture so that it has somewhat jagged edges instead of being just round. Now take a picture of a clear night sky with lots of stars and no moon showing any light. Place that picture behind the day sky picture so the stars can be seen through the hole. Now add in the Hollywood distortion affect used to represent a cloaked ship in Star Trek in the night photo.

Best way I can describe it. Maybe someone else has seen it before now too. Save this for posterity and you never know what can come of it. I've only seen this phenomenon once in my life.
